intro: Blechnum sessilifolia, commonly known as the shield fern, is a species of evergreen fern native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped fronds that are typically leathery and dark green. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, with creeping underground stems that allow it to spread and form dense colonies. Its leaves are usually bipinnate, with closely spaced, linear pinnae that give it a compact appearance. Blechnum sessilifolia thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
